meanings.definition: People who solicit votes or orders, as for a political party or business.
meanings.sent1: The canvassers knocked on doors to ask for support during the election.
meanings.sent2: The company hired canvassers to promote their new product in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The group of canvassers accidentally went to the wrong neighborhood and ended up promoting the wrong candidate!
meanings.sent4: The canvassers were like busy bees buzzing from one house to another, gathering votes.
meanings.sent5: The image of the canvassers with their clipboards became a familiar sight in the community.

meanings.definition: People who conduct a survey or gather information.
meanings.sent1: The team of canvassers went around the city collecting data for the research project.
meanings.sent2: The organization hired canvassers to gather opinions on the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The group of canvassers found out that most people preferred chocolate ice cream over vanilla.
meanings.sent4: The canvassers were like detectives, piecing together information from different sources.
meanings.sent5: The canvassers diligently recorded every response they received during the survey.

meanings.definition: People who examine carefully or discuss thoroughly.
meanings.sent1: The team of canvassers carefully reviewed each document before presenting their findings.
meanings.sent2: The group of canvassers sat down to discuss the implications of the new law.
meanings.sent3: The canvassers spent hours debating the best course of action to take.
meanings.sent4: The canvassers were like scholars, delving deep into the subject matter.
meanings.sent5: The image of the canvassers poring over books and notes became a common sight in the office.
